chart.title: Life expectancy vs. healthcare expenditure
chart.subtitle: The [period life expectancy](#dod:period-life-expectancy) at birth, in a given year. Healthcare expenditure per capita is measured in current international-$, which adjusts for price differences between countries.
chart.citation: UN, World Population Prospects (2024); Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)

Life expectancy - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Va.descriptionShort: Period life expectancy for individuals who have reached age 0. Estimates are expressed as the expected age at death, not as years left to live.
Life expectancy - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Va.citationShort: UN, World Population Prospects (2024) – processed by Our World in Data
Life expectancy - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Va.citationLong: UN, World Population Prospects (2024) – processed by Our World in Data. “Life Expectancy,age 0 – UN WPP” [dataset]. United Nations, “World Population Prospects” [original data].

Current health expenditure per capita, P.titleLong: Current health expenditure per capita, PPP
Current health expenditure per capita, P.citationShort: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024) – processed by Our World in Data
Current health expenditure per capita, P.citationLong: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024) – processed by Our World in Data. “Current health expenditure per capita, PPP” [dataset]. World Health Organization, “World Development Indicators” [original data].

Population (historical).descriptionShort: Population by country, available from 10,000 BCE to 2023, based on data and estimates from different sources.
Population (historical).descriptionProcessing:
The population data is constructed by combining data from multiple sources:

- 10,000 BCE - 1799: Historical estimates by HYDE (v3.3).

- 1800 - 1949: Historical estimates by Gapminder (v7).

- 1950-2023: Population records by the UN World Population Prospects (2024 revision).
Population (historical).citationShort: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Population (historical).citationLong: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Population” [dataset]. PBL Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency, “History Database of the Global Environment 3.3”; Gapminder, “Population v7”; United Nations, “World Population Prospects”; Gapminder, “Systema Globalis” [original data].

World regions according to OWID.citationShort: Our World in Data – processed by Our World in Data
World regions according to OWID.citationLong: Our World in Data – processed by Our World in Data. “World regions according to OWID” [dataset]. Our World in Data, “Regions” [original data].
